title: Chicken Fried Rice Recipe
description: This chicken fried rice recipe is easy to make with cooked chicken, leftover rice, shredded scrambled egg, and soy sauce for an incredibly tasty meal!

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Main Dishes Rice Fried Rice Recipes Chicken Fried Rice 4.5 (2,083) 1,464 Reviews 368 Photos This chicken fried rice recipe is very easy to make and tastes better than takeout! It's basically cooked chicken, rice, soy sauce, and shredded egg stir-fried together. For best results, use leftover cooked rice. Submitted by LISA TOURVILLE Updated on January 9, 2025 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 368 368 368 368 Prep Time: 5 mins Cook Time: 10 mins Total Time: 15 mins Servings: 4 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings 1 large egg 1 tablespoon water 1 tablespoon butter 1 tablespoon vegetable oil 1 medium onion, chopped 2 cups cooked white rice, cold 1 cup cooked, chopped chicken meat 2 tablespoons soy sauce 1 teaspoon ground black pepper or to taste Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Beat egg and water together in small bowl. Melt butter in a large skillet or wok over medium-low heat; add egg and cook without stirring, 1 to 2 minutes. Remove egg from skillet and cut into shreds; set aside. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Heat oil in the same skillet. Add onion; cook and stir until soft, about 3 minutes. Stir in rice, chicken, soy sauce, and pepper. Cook and stir for about 5 minutes; stir in shredded egg. Serve hot. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Cook’s Note You can add any diced vegetables you like with the onion for added color, such as carrots and bell pepper. I Made It Print 5,011 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 255 Calories 10g Fat 26g Carbs 14g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 4 Calories 255 % Daily Value * Total Fat 10g 13% Saturated Fat 3g 17% Cholesterol 83mg 28% Sodium 516mg 22% Total Carbohydrate 26g 9% Dietary Fiber 1g 4% Total Sugars 1g Protein 14g 28% Vitamin C 2mg 2% Calcium 31mg 2% Iron 2mg 11% Potassium 172mg 4% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Chicken Fried Rice 01 of 368 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 368 Photo by  Berta 01/19/2025 Great flavors I doubled the recipe, glad I did .... DELICIOUS 👏🏼👏🏼👏🏼👏🏼 only different thing I'll do next time is add 1 more egg, other than that this is easy and delish!!! 03 of 368 Photo by  PeppyMeal6831 09/26/2024 Needs more flavor OK with tweaks 04 of 368 Photo by  Foodie 05/22/2024 I added extra veggies. I made it like a mix between chicken and vegetables fried rice. Next time, I would add celery and use half the vegetables I used. I used to add the egg raw into the rice and stir it in. I like what's offered in this recipe, easier and a lot less messy. 05 of 368 Photo by  HardyHam8067 04/17/2024 Missing something First of all prep time was agonizing. It required Chinese five spice and ginger. Prior to those additions, Recipe was so bland. It looked pretty though. 06 of 368 Photo by  FancyRoll1257 04/09/2024 OK with tweaks Needs more flavor I think it was too much pepper, but that’s personal preference! Loved it otherwise! 07 of 368 Photo by  Jenny Sak 03/16/2024 Excellent base recipe allowing you to add extras as desired. As others mentioned, I also used toasted sesame oil in place of vegetable oil, minced garlic, 2 eggs, red pepper flakes, scallions, a package of frozen stir fry vegetables in addition to the onion in recipe. Kikkoman makes a nice stir fry sauce (which is definitely cheating), but finished it nicely. I appreciated having this recipe to start the process! 08 of 368 Photo by  Wendy Betzler 03/07/2024 My family loved this, I dad add an extra egg as well as peas, carrots, corn and extra soy sauce. I also used some garlic and garlic salt. I use Jasmine rice, and after it was done in the rice cooker, I spread it on a cookie sheet and put in the freezer to cool down so it did not overcook in the final step. 09 of 368 Photo by  jdog 12/02/2022 Delicious! Took other reviewers recommendations to cook in sesame oil, add ginger, red pepper flakes, sliced water chestnuts, thawed peas, corn, green beans - what a treat!! 10 of 368 Photo by  MirthPrawn4869 09/22/2022 It was simple and easy to make.I also added onions, pees, carrots, and carrots.We loved it.Thank you 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Chinese Chicken Fried Rice 427 Ratings Hibachi-Style Fried Rice 217 Ratings Chicken and Snow Peas 64 Ratings Spicy Chinese Chicken Wings 26 Ratings Ten Minute Szechuan Chicken 408 Ratings Chicken and Veggie Fried Rice Sweet and Sour Chicken Stir-Fry 607 Ratings Bacon and Chicken Fried Rice 29 Ratings Air Fryer General Tso's Chicken 9 Ratings Stir-Fried Chicken with Tofu and Mixed Vegetables 16 Ratings Steamed Garlic Prawns, Chinese Style 12 Ratings Stir-Fried Chicken With Pineapple and Peppers 115 Ratings Adriel's Chinese Curry Chicken 79 Ratings Chicken and Chinese Vegetable Stir-Fry 105 Ratings Sesame Chicken 80 Ratings Deep-Fried Asian Chicken Meatballs Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: LISA TOURVILLE
instructions: Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Beat egg and water together in small bowl. Melt butter in a large skillet or wok over medium-low heat; add egg and cook without stirring, 1 to 2 minutes. Remove egg from skillet and cut into shreds; set aside. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Heat oil in the same skillet. Add onion; cook and stir until soft, about 3 minutes. Stir in rice, chicken, soy sauce, and pepper. Cook and stir for about 5 minutes; stir in shredded egg. Serve hot. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios
